programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers travel to the latest set of auctions in Fullerton, California, where Jarrod and Brandi compete for a storage unit they need to keep their store afloat.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Items include replica swords signed by Kill Bill actor David Carradine, a first-edition of TS Eliot's Four Quartets, a 1965 Battle of the Bulge board game, and a 1920s radium crock.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The action in the shop focuses on Rick as he gets wound up trying to complete some deals.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A burglar is caught in the car park - and when she is taken inside the Golds get a big surprise.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les hands over a lot of money for an item based on the word of a customer, and later, Ashley makes a discovery that leaves him looking foolish.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A Vegas Pawn Star hauls in a crumbling 1957 Chevy 150 for a much-needed restoration. The American Pickers rock up too, hoping to flog some of their vintage valuables..

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick Dale and the team restore a rusty 1920s tyre-changer, and a baseball game from the 1940s is given an urgent makeover.

programme.title: Nightmare in Suburbia
programme.desc: Documentary examining how a wealthy landowner's acrimonious divorce led to murder. In 2011, Adrian Prout finally revealed where his wife's body was buried.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: A look at how Virginia detectives used science and cunning to catch the surprising killer of 16-year-old ballet dancer Meghan Landowski in 2008.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers attend fiercely competitive auctions in Garland, where Moe and Mary find a rare historical artefact.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers visit the Dallas suburb of Addison, where the Rangers find a nautical antique and Jenny uncovers a piece of Hollywood memorabilia.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les is furious when a member of Seth's team makes a huge mistake, but Seth is unwilling to reveal the culprit so takes a stand against his father.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Lese is furious to find broken merchandise in the shop and issues the ultimate threat for the next person who steps out of line.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A collection of original 1960s NBC posters arrive at the shop, and the team is asked to appraise a 1966 Harley Davidson.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers examine a medal with links to Captain Cook, and a putter from the famed 1963 Frank Sinatra Invitational. Plus, Rick's stress levels hit a new high.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: A selection of recently declassified FBI files provides new evidence for the debate over whether alien life really exists, and theorists claim the Vatican may be hiding the truth.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate alleged sightings of UFOs during the Black Death, and examine the theory that aliens may have inflicted the disease on the human race.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team repairs a 1967 dirt-road motorbike, while Tyler and Rick restore an airline flight sign.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick and his team restore a 1962 scooter and a mini oil tanker from the 1930s in dire need of repair.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The staff assess a pre-Revolutionary American pewter tankard, postcards by American artist Jean-Michel Basquiat and a 1960s Hydro-Cycle Barracuda watercraft.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Astronomer Edwin Hubble's autograph is appraised, along with an 1850s patent model self-lighting and extinguishing lantern. Also brought to the staff's attention are a Starrett Food Chopper and an 1871 British Martini-Henry Short Lever Rifle.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers are far from home and get the opportunity to find out who has the skills for the job and who is just relying on luck.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell takes a gamble on a locker completely covered with blankets, while Brandi makes a risky decision.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: A locker at an auction in Arlington catches Vic's eye, but Bubba suspects it could have been used for shady dealings.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba are cautiously optimistic as they head to auctions in Mesquite, Nevada, a location that has not proven to be particularly fruitful for them in the past.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: After a first round besieged with setbacks, two bladesmiths go on to the finals to craft an Ancient Roman gladiator's scissor.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The staff examine items signed by President Franklin D Roosevelt, as well as a rare photograph taken during baseball star Babe Ruth's debut season.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An original sketch from a popular animation is brought into the shop, and Rick is offered what is believed to be a first edition of Richard Nixon's memoir.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Experts investigate why so many UFO sightings take place in Los Angeles, and believe the answer may lie underwater.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts examine the ruins left by ancient civilisations, including the Mayans, in the hope of finding evidence of extraterrestrial contact.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: When Rich slips up, tensions run high after Les threatens to fire the next bumbling employee. It's Rich who makes the next error, leading to the biggest showdown in the history of the store.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds have the opportunity of a lifetime when they stumble upon pieces of art that could be worth millions. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell finds a box of old books, Jarrod and Brandi battle for a unit filled with classic signs, and Barry takes a chance on a mystery trunk.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi uncover what appears to be an antique wine rack, while Dave and Barry test each other's knowledge of oddities.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A lunar Bible from Apollo 14, a 1930s Buck Rogers disintegrator gun, miniature samples of a 1950s kitchen and a 1950s Beetle Bailey original print are among the items viewed.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey checks out a Rolex water-pressure tester, while Rick sets his sights on a drawing by John Lennon.

programme.title: Paranormal: Caught On Camera
programme.desc: A famous monster washes up on a New York beach, parents catch ghosts haunting nurseries on baby monitors and a UFO saves a Russian town.

programme.title: Paranatural
programme.desc: Experts investigate alleged sightings of mystery creatures in the world's lakes and lochs, and whether living descendants of the dinosaurs could exist underwater.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers are far from home and get the opportunity to find out who has the skills for the job and who is just relying on luck.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell takes a gamble on a locker completely covered with blankets, while Brandi makes a risky decision.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Guests Jeremy Clarkson, Vic Reeves and Clive Anderson join regular contributor Alan Davies and host Stephen Fry in the quiz show with a difference. Coming under discussion is the ambitious 'E' subject - everything, with the questions so difficult that points are awarded for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Loyiso Gola, Milton Jones, Miles Jupp, Ellie Taylor and Josh Widdicombe join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Guests David Mitchell, Dara O Briain and Phill Jupitus join regular contributor Alan Davies and host Stephen Fry in the quiz show with a difference. Coming under discussion are subjects beginning with 'E', including Europe, with the questions so difficult that points are awarded for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Guests Jeremy Clarkson, Vic Reeves and Clive Anderson join regular contributor Alan Davies and host Stephen Fry in the quiz show with a difference. Coming under discussion is the ambitious 'E' subject - everything, with the questions so difficult that points are awarded for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Richard Osman hosts as BBC Breakfast's Naga Munchetty, singer Jordan Stephens, actor Sally Lindsay and comedian David O'Doherty test their general knowledge.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Loyiso Gola, Milton Jones, Miles Jupp, Ellie Taylor and Josh Widdicombe join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Thanks to back flips and rail rides, Tim and Gendle are in BMX bike heaven. With the clock ticking it is down to Joe and the build team to construct the ultimate BMX set-up.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Officers are called upon to restrain a man having a bad reaction to the 'zombie' drug Black Mamba. Cutting-edge documentary following the work of the Staffordshire Police force.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz are in seventh heaven when Cheap Trick guitarist Rick Nielsen opens the doors to his private rock 'n' roll warehouse.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Former boxer Brandon Bernier and his wife Lori take part in a bidding war for a locker full of alcohol.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon Bernier and his wife Lori discover voodoo dolls after buying storage units at auction in New Orleans.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank bid on the chassis of a famous car, and invest in a restoration project.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike uncovers a 1915 motorcycle and a valuable bear trap before falling prey to one of Frank and Danielle's pranks.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: The staging of the Aintree Grand National sees the team working flat-out trying to get two new police motorbikes converted in time. Second-in-command Tony finds himself on the wrong end of a 4x4 challenge.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May test-drive an Aston Martin DBS Convertible, a Ferrari California and a Lamborghini Gallardo Convertible through Romania, searching for the mountain highway built during the reign of the country's former dictator Nicolae Ceausescu - allegedly the best road to drive on in the world. Actor Eric Bana is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Documentary series following the work of police officers through body-worn cameras.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Steve Darnell and the crew work on a tatty old vehicle that has been sprung from the desert and looks like something from the Mad Max movies.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters try to impress Oxford residents by building an electric car, and refuse to let an unenthusiastic response deter them from sitting in on the machine's crash-test before handing it over to the Stig's environmentally friendly cousin. Actor Michael Sheen is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car, and Jeremy Clarkson pits the Corvette ZR1 against the Audi R8 V10

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond debate which company has made the greatest number of exceptional vehicles, and James May finds a way of transporting caravans to campsites without inconveniencing other road users. The Top Gear track plays host to a replica of one of the world's most famous rally cars, and broadcaster Chris Evans - some five years before he was announced as the show's new presenter - is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended edition of the comedy panel show, in which correctness and even intelligence go out of the window, in favour of answers the host finds most interesting. This time, Sandi Toksvig, Aisling Bea, Susan Calman and regular panellist Alan Davies navigate the topic of mathematics.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Naga Munchetty, Jordan Stephens, Sally Lindsay and David O'Doherty test their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by TV presenter Patrick Kielty, actor Bernard Cribbins, Dragons' Den judge Deborah Meaden and comedian Mark Watson on the comedy panel show. Rob Brydon chairs as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: John Bishop, Chris Addison, Joanna Page and Patsy Palmer join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in the comedy panel show hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Sarah Millican, Russell Kane and Steve Hughes
programme.desc: Sarah Millican hosts the stand-up show recorded at London's Hammersmith Apollo, introducing routines by Australian funnyman Steve Hughes and award-winning comic Russell Kane, who both give their own take on modern life.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies delivers angry appraisals from his comfy throne, as Ed Gamble dons a baby's bonnet, Katy Wix makes Alex Horne wince and Rose Matafeo does a spot of screaming.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Correctness and even intelligence go out of the window in this quiz, in which Alan Davies, Jo Brand, Vic Reeves and Clive Anderson answer questions on the theme of espionage. Host Stephen Fry will be awarding points for the answers he finds most interesting.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Alan Davies, Jimmy Carr, Phill Jupitus and David Mitchell answer Stephen Fry's questions about eyes and ears. Correctness and even intelligence go out of the window when the questions are so difficult points are awarded for the answers the host finds most interesting.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Blanco ends up in the prison hospital, where he fears he is about to shuffle off this mortal coil and entrusts the whereabouts of his stashed fortune to fellow inmate Fletch, who is sharing a ward with him. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber takes up boxing and enters the prison championships. He is hot favourite to win until Fletcher is given the task of fixing the contest and nobbling his cell-mate. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, Richard Beckinsale and Peter Vaughan.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates the story of the D-Day landings in June 1944, when the Allies launched the biggest ever amphibious invasion on the beaches of Normandy. Although both sides suffered heavy casualties, it proved to be the turning point in the war against Germany.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The largest and most sophisticated radio telescope on the planet, which draws inspiration from geodesic dome designs and the work of 18th-century engineer Jean Marie Jacquard.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Napoleon: The Egyptian Campaign
programme.desc: Part two of two. How the 1798 military expedition to occupy Egypt was ultimately defeated, but secured a lasting legacy by marking the birth of Egyptology.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The creation of London's Crossrail network, a project of staggering proportions, with 10,000 personnel working across 40 sites and on 118km of track. The focus should have been on the impressive engineering feat, though delays and budgets have become the focus of attention.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Concrete channels hidden in a mountaintop forest, a collapsing bridge, a marooned military base and the upright rusting carcass of ship.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Nazi occupation of Holland, which began relatively peacefully with Dutch civil servants continuing to run their own country, but eventually resulted in many thousands of deaths through the attempted elimination of Jewish citizens and starvation of the non-Jewish inhabitants. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Secrets of the Murder Bureau
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates a secret department of the Bulgarian government charged with carrying out assassinations in nine other countries during the Cold War.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The creation of London's Crossrail network, a project of staggering proportions, with 10,000 personnel working across 40 sites and on 118km of track. The focus should have been on the impressive engineering feat, though delays and budgets have become the focus of attention.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The changing landscape of the coastline from Newcastle to Hull. Neil Oliver explores the ancient coastal home of the Venerable Bede, and goes to Bridlington to learn about the 200-year struggle to design an unsinkable lifeboat. Mark Horton discovers how laser technology could predict coastal erosion, Dick Strawbridge finds out how Middlesbrough's Transporter Bridge put the city on the map, and Miranda Krestovnikoff heads to Bempton Cliffs.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Dark Truth of the Templars
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston uncovers the secrets of the Knights Templar and challenges the accepted views of the order that angered medieval Europe.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of animals that live in the desert, including a pride of desert lions that risks hunting a giraffe several times their size. The film also features an immense swarm of locusts, sand grouse flying for 120 miles to gather water for their offspring, and an unprecedented recording of a tiny bat defending itself against one of the world's deadliest scorpions.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of three preserved steam railway lines - the South Devon Railway heritage line, the Ffestiniog and Welsh Highlands Railway and the Great Central Railway. Sports scientist Megan Smith has a dream of tending the fire of a steam locomotive on the Ffestiniog & Welsh Highland Railway, and she stokes the bolier of NG143 and sets off along the 25 miles from Caernarfon to Porthmadog.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Concrete channels hidden in a mountaintop forest, a collapsing bridge, a marooned military base and the upright rusting carcass of ship.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Nazi occupation of Holland, which began relatively peacefully with Dutch civil servants continuing to run their own country, but eventually resulted in many thousands of deaths through the attempted elimination of Jewish citizens and starvation of the non-Jewish inhabitants. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: At the Ffestiniog and Welsh Highlands Railway, manager Stephen Greig is trying to ensure that all goes to plan ahead of the opening of the new station at Caernarfon.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A towering structure with an explosive past, a deserted cityscape, a mysterious top-secret facility and a vast Nazi construction.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Nato's Airborne Warning and Control System, known as Awac, a cutting-edge aircraft with a huge radar dome mounted on its roof that enables pilots to spot hostile intrusion as they protect state borders of the countries in the Nato alliance. One of the most complex surveillance aircrafts in the world, it is able to seek out, locate, and defend against threats - no matter how fast moving or well hidden.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Peace evades the inmates of Slade Prison, and Fletcher's bid to find a little tranquillity seems destined to fail. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Brian Wilde.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Blanco ends up in the prison hospital, where he fears he is about to shuffle off this mortal coil and entrusts the whereabouts of his stashed fortune to fellow inmate Fletch, who is sharing a ward with him. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber takes up boxing and enters the prison championships. He is hot favourite to win until Fletcher is given the task of fixing the contest and nobbling his cell-mate. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, Richard Beckinsale and Peter Vaughan.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: At the Ffestiniog and Welsh Highlands Railway, manager Stephen Greig is trying to ensure that all goes to plan ahead of the opening of the new station at Caernarfon.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: In an episode originally screened in 1992, the long suffering Scottish detective tries to defend a childhood friend recently released from prison when a series of shootings puts him in the frame for murder. Mark McManus stars as gruff crime buster Jim Taggart, while series regulars Blythe Duff (DS Jackie Reid) and James MacPherson (Mike Jardine) also star. There's also an appearance from Clare Grogan, best known for her work with the band Altered Images and cult TV hit Red Dwarf.

programme.title: Mansfield Park
programme.desc: Part four of six. The Mansfield Theatricals come to an abrupt end when Sir Thomas unexpectedly returns from Antigua. Jane Austen adaptation, starring Sylvestra Le Touzel.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits Montford Cottage in Pendle, Lancashire, where she discovers how the haven was created and reveals a few of her own horticultural secrets.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Period medical drama chronicling the personal and professional consequences of Eleanor Bramwell's determined quest to become the first female surgeon at the East London Hospital. Jemma Redgrave stars.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: A Second World War bomb is discovered, which puts the wives at risk. Meanwhile, the clock begins to tick for Cate's unborn child.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: New recruit PC Leela Kapoor proves her mettle on her first day at Sun Hill, but the exposure of a dark secret from her past sours her working relationship with Sheelagh. Jim contemplates stepping outside the law to pay off his gambling debts, while another shooting by the serial sniper leads to an influx of armed officers - one of whom, Sergeant Mark Rollins, just happens to be Lance's boyfriend.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Robert Powell stars as Chrissie's father, whom she urges to return to Holby and help Tricia through her illness. However, he proves reluctant, explaining that she doesn't know what really happened between them. Diane attends a seminar, but is appalled to discover it's being held by Dominic Fryer, who offers to boost her career in return for picking up where they left off. Back at the hospital, Zubin confesses to Ric why he didn't tell him about Leo's baby - but can't bring himself to reveal the whole truth.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A host of new staff members graces the wards of Holby following Jude and Matt's departure. Charlie receives a phone call advising there has been a bomb threat in the Towers shopping centre - which is where Baz is heading on her day off. Meanwhile, a middle-aged man falls from a roof and Josh and Liz are forced to deliver a baby in an ambulance.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jim sinks to a new low when he pawns valuable police evidence to raise the cash he needs to pay off his gambling debts - then promptly blows the lot on a horse. Andrea refuses to abandon her undercover assignment even though Adam is getting uncomfortably close to the truth. Smithy finds the sniper's rifle and it appears to be only a matter of time before the culprit is finally caught - but not everything is as it seems.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Aids-sufferer Gill is dying, so she and Mark throw away their sadness and prepare to marry.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A car reverses too far and plunges into the water at Surrey Docks, where members of the fire-fighting team are familiarising themselves with the new shopping complex. With Sean Blowers, Richard Walsh and Glen Murphy.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The dodgy dealer agrees to help Charlotte's friend Mary Gladden save a nursing home by valuing and selling its antiques - only to find himself in the line of fire as someone makes an attempt on his life. Drama, starring Ian McShane, Dudley Sutton, Caroline Langrishe and Susan Fleetwood.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: A wealthy computer engineer receives a series of death threats - and Jim has no idea who the culprit might be. Connie Booth and Michael Gambon guest star.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Freddie Boswell returns home, shocking Nellie with his new perspective on life. Julie and Aveline create chaos when they each announce they are leaving, while Adrian decides that Carmen is driven too much by pure lust rather than wanting to develop a proper relationship.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: The staff at Grace Bros discover a novel use for a closed-circuit security system. Vintage comedy, starring John Inman.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel is asked to spice up the script for his mini-series and make it more raunchy, so one of Jean's secretaries is brought in to help. Comedy, starring Geoffrey Palmer and Judi Dench.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The arrival of Clegg's cousin threatens to spell the end of the gang's gentle walks, so they resolve to get rid of him. Aubrey finds he can still beat Billy and Alvin cycling up hills, but discovers his own weakness. Starring Peter Sallis.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: At the behest of a local businessman, unlikely manhunter Hetty fearlessly sets out in search of the thugs responsible for attacking Asian businessmen. She soon discovers that every victim has been a restaurant owner, but then Hetty herself becomes a target of the gang involved.

programme.title: Ms Fisher's Modern Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Part one of two. After two pop singers are electrocuted while performing on a TV music show, Peregrine's impartiality is tested when an old boyfriend is named as the lead suspect in the case. Geraldine Hakewill stars.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team members have to draw on their powers of detection and discretion when a painting in the Queen's private collection is found to be a fake - and all the clues lead to an art forger and political activist who seemingly committed suicide after a fire destroyed his studio. Meanwhile, prospective grandfather Standing has to sell his beloved Triumph Stag to buy his pregnant daughter a pushchair. Anthony Head guest stars alongside Dennis Waterman and Amanda Redman.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: The Glaswegian detective (Mark McManus) and sidekick Jardine investigate the latest in a long line of murders by a calculating killer known only as the Mechanic. Feature-length episode of the police drama, starring Mark McManus, James Macpherson, Sian Thomas and John Bluthal.

programme.desc: Dermot Murnaghan brings perspective to the day's national and international news, with in-depth reporting, interviews, analysis from our specialist correspondents and lively debate.

programme.title: Sky News at 9
programme.desc: A round-up of the stories that have hit the headlines today, featuring reports from correspondents around the world. Presented by Anna Botting.

programme.title: Sky News at 9
programme.desc: A round-up of the stories that have hit the headlines today, featuring reports from correspondents around the world. Presented by Anna Botting.

programme.title: Sky News at 10
programme.desc: A round-up of the stories that have hit the headlines today, with Anna Botting.

programme.title: Press Preview

programme.title: Sky News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's leading stories with Anna Botting.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: White House Farm
programme.desc: After a vital discovery at the farm, Stan and Mick feel closer to shoring up their own suspicions about Jeremy. The arrival of Brett, a friend from New Zealand (played by Game of Thrones star Alfie Allen), increases tensions between Jeremy and Julie, while Ann grows ever more alarmed and suspicious of her cousin Jeremy's behaviour, and his handling of the family estate. As preparations for the inquest continue, Stan is concerned that if the bodies are released for cremation, vital evidence will be lost for ever.

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef travels through Charente in south-west France, visiting a distillery in the Cognac region, meeting a miller who still uses traditional methods to make award-winning brioche loaves, and following in the Queen Mother's footsteps with a visit to Chateau de Venteuil, home of the De La Rochefoucauld family. Along the way he creates a salad incorporating some of the region's best produce, classic French onion soup and pays homage to the patron saint of pastry chefs with a stunning dessert.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Another helping of topical studio discussion from a female perspective, featuring celebrity interviews.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A team of five answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Subjects in this episode include The Oscars, Mr Men and tennis. Game show, hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Sally, Mark, Ellis and Jo pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Sarah is shocked when confronted by Charity, who struggles to process everything. A decision is made regarding the future.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: When Maria suffers a dizzy spell and tells Ali she's bleeding, he insists on driving her to hospital for a scan. Gemma and Chesney are furious when they realise they've been removed from a marketing campaign, and Daniel thanks Bethany for helping him through such a terrible ordeal.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh & Son: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: The Chase presenter Bradley Walsh and his son Barney return for a second series as they embark on another road trip across America together. This time, the actor and his son arrive in Ohio, where they head for Dayton - the birthplace of aviation - before the pair attend a local rodeo later that evening. Brad soon realises that they are not just there to spectate on the sport, they are also expected to take part. However, a nasty fall from an angry bull means Brad spends the rest of the night in hospital.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Ali struggles to comfort Maria as she reveals how she lost a baby 11 years ago and can't bear to go through it again. Imran advises a furious Gemma that there's nothing she can do about Freshco's advertising decisions. Sarah tells Bethany to tread carefully with Daniel.

programme.title: White House Farm
programme.desc: The funerals approach, and without the answers he needs and still more questions being thrown up from White House Farm, Stan's efforts remain fruitless. When all looks lost for Stan and Mick solving the case, a vital witness comes forward. Six-part drama based on the true story of the mass murder of a family in an Essex farmhouse in August 1985, providing a fresh insight into the tragic events. Starring Alfie Allen, Mark Addy and Andrew Frame.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.desc: Analysis of the day's headlines from a Scottish perspective, plus local news from Aberdeen, Edinburgh and Glasgow.

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show presented by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme.

programme.title: Hit After Hit
programme.desc: Nothing but the biggest hits by your favourite stars back to back.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How oranges are turned into marmalade, and a look at printed dresses.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer bags a bargain example of one of his dream cars - a Ford Fiesta XR2 - but there is only 1,000 to spend on repairs.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini travels to Ohio to buy a Pierce Arrow, but is forced to pull out of the purchase when the owner backtracks on his decision to sell.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini rescues a Jaguar 120 after a recluse's car-collecting becomes a hoarding habit.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Cameras capture more road-based disasters, including hot rides going up in flames, freaky motorcycle wipeouts, and unsettling 'redneck' car hobbies that defy all logic.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Footage of dramatic road-based clashes, as drivers and pedestrians unleash their rage, creating chaos on the highways. Plus, coverage of a cringe-worthy crossing incident.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A truck crash sends tons of lemons off a bridge onto pedestrians below, a landslide wrecks homes in Brazil, and a snowmobiler is buried by an avalanche.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Footage of a gas leak that triggers a fireball. Plus, a daredevil crashes his all-terrain vehicle during a back-flip, and a pilot-less plane plunges towards a crowd.

programme.title: Heli-Loggers
programme.desc: The loggers are reminded of the dangers of their work while harvesting a grove of 100 trees.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: The team helps a man who has bought the car of his dreams - a 1970 Mustang - but cannot afford to restore it.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how waste is collected in Venice, how Australia's famous sheepskin boots are made, and how pond algae is turned into a health supplement.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: A fancy fairground waltzer, an ancient coffee machine and a huge oak table are restored in the workshops of some of the UK's most celebrated crafts people.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The midpoint of the season looms, and working without sleep means the fishermen begin to suffer from fatigue. Harsh weather makes the fleet's task even more perilous than usual and professional efficiency soon gives way to a slow grind as morale is tested.

programme.title: Gold Divers: Under the Ice
programme.desc: With Cody out of action, Phil gets a chance to redeem himself and hopes extra training will restore his confidence. Meanwhile, a tired tender puts Jesse's life in danger.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: There's trouble in the wind for Kurt, who is struggling with a load causing oversized problems. Meanwhile, for Johnny on the Tanami Track, it's too hard one minute and too soft the next.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China are asked to restore a powerful, luxury 1983 Mercedes 500 SEC, but face a steady challenge in returning it to its former glory.

programme.title: Supertruckers
programme.desc: The team moves a huge cheese vat from a rural Welsh factory to Felixstowe in Suffolk for shipment abroad. A rookie error occurs while moving three Bulldog tanks to Germany.

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: Apollo 12 astronauts bring back something alive from the moon and NASA track an asteroid heading towards Earth only to make a shocking discovery.

programme.title: Railroad Australia
programme.desc: One man and a huge train take on the unforgiving Pilbara. In Sydney, four extreme train enthusiasts tackle its rail network in the All Stations Challenge.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: As the end of the king crab season draws near, the fishing fleet's captains and crews face the familiar prospect of the long and gruelling journey to the finish line.

programme.title: Gold Divers: Under the Ice
programme.desc: As the end of the season approaches, the crew members of The Clark find an ominous sign that the ice is quickly melting.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Salvage supremo Drew Pritchard is spoiled for choice at a dealership in Henley, Oxfordshire. He meets a good match in Marlborough, Wiltshire, and tries to score a win against the house at a bingo hall.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Mark Cromwell and his team drag a heavyweight, million-dollar shed through the narrow streets of Adelaide. Meanwhile, livestock trucker Brenton has three days to move 20,000 cattle.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer bags a bargain example of one of his dream cars - a Ford Fiesta XR2 - but there is only 1,000 to spend on repairs.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: The artisan restorers revamp a fragile standing mirror needing some love, a classic armchair and a large railway station clock. Rebecca Pritchard examines their origins.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects. The bigger the hoard, the happier he is.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard teams up with Turbo Pickers' Paul Cowland for a motoring mission. They scour the UK, buying, restoring and selling classic cars.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Bitesize
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard wants to stand out from the competition in Britain. He and friend Tee head to Italy hoping to find some antiques that his rivals won't be able to match.

programme.title: Carabao Cup on Quest
programme.desc: Action from the semi-final second-leg ties, featuring Manchester City v Manchester United and Aston Villa v Leicester City.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: The case of a 10-year-old girl abducted in front of her home by a predator in a white truck. FBI agents were tasked with finding Pamela before it was too late.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Evidence found underwater, including the case of a woman discovered floating in a pond and a man who claimed his girlfriend was killed by a flash flood.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: In 1990, Seattle was terrorised by James Cushing, a disturbed man obsessed with alleged murderess Lizzie Borden. His crime spree culminated in a vicious homicide.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of 17-year-old Bridgett Frisbie, who was lured to woodland near her Texas home town in April 2011 and shot dead. Her friend Alex Olivieri killed the teenager to prevent her revealing her knowledge of an earlier crime in which he was involved.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Recounting how years after a successful TV producer was gunned down in his New York office, a tip led the FBI to a murderous entertainment industry giant.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: Vet Rachel Lee is determined to save an injured dog that has a deep wound on its neck.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Veterinary surgeon Chris Brown hopes to find a new home for an orphaned Shih Tzu with a chronic ear problem.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: To Buy or Not to Buy
programme.desc: Claudia's professional problems continue, resulting in more meetings. Plus, a woman from Buffalo brings her fiance to the store.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Petite bride Christine hopes to find a gown to match her 1920s-themed wedding, while Valentina returns for her fitting to add a personal touch to her dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Julie misses her mum, but is staying positive that she will find the perfect dress. Meanwhile, Emily has tried on 20 gowns and is hoping Lori can help her find the perfect one.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Feisty meerkats are not impressed by a visit from the vet, a cat needs treatment after being mauled by two dogs, and an angry alligator is brought in for x-rays.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigator Stephen Goldman rescues a miniature horse from a neglectful owner and captures two abandoned dogs.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigator Stephen Goldman rescues a dog that has become trapped in a fence and is so undernourished it can barely walk.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms three items from the Witley Recycling Centre in Surrey, including a collection of fishing rods, and a reproduction designer chair.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How the analysis of insects found on dead bodies can be used to calculate time of death, and even offer clues to the victim's identity.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 19-year-old Katelin Akens, who vanished in a Virginia shopping mall, while en route to the airport to fly home to her fiancee.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Danielle Imbo and Richard Petrone, who vanished after leaving a night club on Philadelphia's South Street in February 2005. No evidence of their fate has emerged in the years since, and nor has there been any sight of Petrone's missing vehicle.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The red carpet is rolled out in this edition of the show, and with a celebrity in the salon, there is no shortage of attitude.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Nicole shops with the help of her psychic aunt, Desiree consults her 90-year-old grandmother and Allyson tries to match a century-old veil with a modern dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Randi is having a carnival wedding and wants a polka-dot gown, while opera singer Mary seeks a dress to match her personality.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Nicole leaves her young quadruplets at home as she shops, while cancer patient Margo wants a dress that will give her a boost.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Heather looks for a dramatic gown that complements her hips, while body-conscious Kristyn finally drops by, having avoided wedding dress shopping for a year.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Shari looks for a vow renewal dress with her fussy husband, Alex must find a gown in 24 hours and Ebony feels nervous about her fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Kandice travels from Texas to find a striking dress for her vow renewal, while Barbara wants a sexy gown with sparkle to match her stilettos.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Violet wants a tight-fitting gown to wear at her Dominican Republic wedding, fussy Rachel hopes Kleinfeld's will be her last stop and Leighann has high standards.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Salvage supremo Drew Pritchard is spoiled for choice at a dealership in Henley, Oxfordshire. He meets a good match in Marlborough, Wiltshire, and tries to score a win against the house at a bingo hall.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms three items from the Witley Recycling Centre in Surrey, including a collection of fishing rods, and a reproduction designer chair.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. When Angela's family is unable to join her on her weight-loss journey, she reaches out to an old love, who is willing to make the trip to Texas with her.

programme.title: Long Lost Family Australia
programme.desc: Chrissie Swan and Anh Do help 36-year-old mother-of-four Emma find her birth father Ken. Plus, assistance is offered to 27-year-old Sian Cavanagh, who is looking for her half-sister Alana.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.sub-title: My Baby's Face Tumour: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: Just after 16-month-old Makaila was born, doctors found a tumour on her face that threatened to choke and kill her. Now, her parents have found a surgeon to try and remove it.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: The death of teenage mother Rachel Timmerman, who eloped with an unknown man and was found a fortnight later in a lake with weights attached to her body. The FBI began a desperate search to determine the whereabouts of the 12-month-old child she had with her.
